headline: Arnold Palmer Invitational 2022: Scottie Scheffler Earns 2nd Win in Last 3 Starts
author: Doric Sam
sentences: #APInv pic.twitter.com/45K9a5bnum Scheffler recorded three birdies and three bogeys on the day, but it was enough to secure the victory as he managed to make par on his last six holes.
Rory McIlroy (+1) was in striking distance of the lead when he began the final round, but he failed to find the magic he had in Round 1 when he opened with a seven-under 65.
pic.twitter.com/xrfvaZCMrr Golf Channel Scottie Scheffler earns his second career PGA TOUR win in his last three starts!
The course proved tough for the players yet again, as no one recorded a round better than four under for the second straight day.
Scottie Scheffler was victorious in the 2022 Arnold Palmer Invitational at Bay Hill Golf Course in Orlando, Florida, on Sunday.
Horschel had a tough run early on, but a couple of late birdies put him one shot back of the lead heading into the final hole.
The lead bounced around a few times Sunday with players like Viktor Hovland and Gary Woodland taking the top spot at times.
The next PGA Tour event on the schedule is The Players Championship, which will be held at TPC Sawgrass starting Thursday.
Scheffler won by one stroke after finishing at even par in the final round to post a total score of five-under 283.
He notched a four-under 68 with an eagle on the 16th hole to build some momentum heading into the final round.
It's the second PGA Tour victory of Scheffler's career following his win at the Phoenix Open three weeks ago.
Scottie Scheffler is victorious @APInv!
Scheffler entered the day in sole possession of fourth place after a strong showing in Round 3.
He finished at four over for the second consecutive day to close the tournament tied for 13th.
Scheffler's consistency on the back nine helped him hold off a hard-charging field.
Billy Horschel and Talor Gooch entered the day tied for the lead at seven under.
He struggled mightily with four bogeys and a double bogey on the seventh hole.

Sam Burns, Matt Fitzpatrick (-1): $339,000
Final leaderboard via PGATour.com.
Hovland couldn't overcome a five-bogey outing despite some impressive shots.
With Sunday's win, he moved into first place in the FedEx Cup standings.
Gooch tumbled to seventh after limping to a five-over 77 on Sunday.

Tyrrell Hatton, Viktor Hovland, Billy Horschel (-4): $908,000
T5.
